choiceresponse.label: Which of the following questions would be trivial to cheat on as a Math Expression Input problem?

checkboxgroup.choice: Solve \( y = mx + b \) for x
Take the integral of \( sin(x) + x^2 \)

div.p: Math expression input problems (also known as "formulainput" problems for the type of tag they use) do not do any algebra on their own. Instead, they rely on numerical result matching, inputting numbers for each variable and comparing the outputs of an expression. Therefore, learners can simply copy the original expression into the problem for a "simplify" or "expand" exercise and get full credit.
